Recipe.title: Dutch Spanish Rice
Recipe.Description:
Ransom's dad, Grandpa John, originally cooked a version of this recipe over a camp fire in a Dutch Oven. He would cook it with plenty of hamburger and homemade bottled tomatoes and serve it as a main course.
This recipe is a little simpler and is intended as a side-dish.

section.instruction: Chop Onions into small pieces. (about ½&inch; &by; 1&inch;)
In a large pot, combine Onions and Hamburger, and cook on high until hamburger is browned.
Add Rice, Tomatoes, Tomato Sauce, Salt, Pepper and Water, then mix well.
Put a lid on the pot and stirring frequently with a Spatula, heat mixture until it starts to boil.
While mixture is heating, cut Peppers into small pieces (about ½&inch; &by; 1&inch;), then stir them into the mixture.
Once mixture starts to boil, reduce heat to medium.
Stirring occasionally, let simmer until rice is cooked. (About 30-45 minutes.)

Notes.note:
It is crucial to scrape the bottom well when stirring!
Otherwise, everything will end up tasting burned.

Modifications.modification: Add an extra pound or two of Hamburger to turn this into a main course instead of a side dish. NOTE: Main course servings are about double side-dish servings, so it will serve only 5-6 people.

If you wish larger chunks of Tomato, you can use cans of Sliced or even Stewed Tomatoes.
If you do so, you may wish to use your Spatula to break up the bigger pieces.

For a little savorier taste, use 2 Poblano peppers instead of the Green Bell Pepper.
If you do this, add them when adding the Onions instead of later on.
